theGreatGatsby.title: The Great Gatsby
theGreatGatsby.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
theGreatGatsby.description: A novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, it tells the story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

toKillAMockingbird.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
toKillAMockingbird.author: Harper Lee
toKillAMockingbird.description: A gripping novel set in the Deep South during the 1930s, it explores themes of racial injustice, moral growth, and the loss of innocence.

nineteenEightyFour.author: George Orwell
nineteenEightyFour.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society controlled by 'Big Brother', where individual freedom and truth are suppressed.

prideAndPrejudice.title: Pride and Prejudice
prideAndPrejudice.author: Jane Austen
prideAndPrejudice.description: A classic romance novel set in 19th century England, focusing on Elizabeth Bennet's evolving relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.

mobyDick.title: Moby Dick
mobyDick.author: Herman Melville
mobyDick.description: A sailor named Ishmael narrates the obsessive quest of Captain Ahab to hunt down the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.
